pullrequest.title: Use internal urdf when we can't find it externally.

content.raw:
Sorry to arrive late but from my perspective the logic of auto-enable/disable features in presence/absence of system installed software is not a good practice. I mean, if I run `cmake .. -DUSE_INTERNAL_URDF:BOOL=False`  it should never end up being True. It can fail or not but in my opinion the build system should not change the explicit option asked from the user at configuration time.

If our infrastructure is failing because of the previous change, I think that the best option is to [fix or patch it](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/386) instead making the software to be adapted to how our infrastructure is working.
